24#include <stdio.h>
25#include "assert.h"
26#include "errarg.h"
27
28errarg::errarg(const char *p) : type(STRING)
29{
30 s = p ? p : "(null)";
31}
32
33errarg::errarg() : type(EMPTY)
34{
35}
36
37errarg::errarg(int nn) : type(INTEGER)
38{
39 n = nn;
40}
41
42errarg::errarg(unsigned int uu) : type(UNSIGNED_INTEGER)
43{
44 u = uu;
45}
46
47errarg::errarg(char cc) : type(CHAR)
48{
49 c = cc;
50}
51
52errarg::errarg(unsigned char cc) : type(CHAR)
53{
54 c = cc;
55}
56
57errarg::errarg(double dd) : type(DOUBLE)
58{
59 d = dd;
60}
61
62int errarg::empty() const
63{
64 return type == EMPTY;
65}
66
67extern "C" {
68 const char *i_to_a(int);
69 const char *ui_to_a(unsigned int);
70}
71
72void errarg::print() const
73{
74 switch (type) {
75 case INTEGER:
76 fputs(i_to_a(n), stderr);
77 break;
78 case UNSIGNED_INTEGER:
79 fputs(ui_to_a(u), stderr);
80 break;
81 case CHAR:
82 putc(c, stderr);
83 break;
84 case STRING:
85 fputs(s, stderr);
86 break;
87 case DOUBLE:
88 fprintf(stderr, "%g", d);
89 break;
90 case EMPTY:
91 break;
92 }
93}
94
95errarg empty_errarg;
96
97void errprint(const char *format,
98 const errarg &arg1,
99 const errarg &arg2,
100 const errarg &arg3)
101{
102 assert(format != 0);
103 char c;
104 while ((c = *format++) != '\0') {
105 if (c == '%') {
106 c = *format++;
107 switch(c) {
108 case '%':
109 fputc('%', stderr);
110 break;
111 case '1':
112 assert(!arg1.empty());
113 arg1.print();
114 break;
115 case '2':
116 assert(!arg2.empty());
117 arg2.print();
118 break;
119 case '3':
120 assert(!arg3.empty());
121 arg3.print();
122 break;
123 default:
124 assert(0);
125 }
126 }
127 else
128 putc(c, stderr);
129 }
130}
